Class StatsUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • StatsUtil

  • public class StatsUtil
extends java.lang.Object
    StatsUtil.java This file is a part of a program which serves as a utility for prediction and data analysis of experimental and simulated data Copyright (C) 2012-2014 Magdalen Berns This program is free software: you can redistribute it and/or modify it under the terms of the GNU General Public License as published by the Free Software Foundation, either version 3 of the License, or (at your option) any later version.         Parameters:

        yMean - The mean value of the y coordinate of the data being analysed
        gradient - The gradient
        Returns:

        offset - The offset constant value on the y axis

      • linearCorrelationCoefficient

        public static double linearCorrelationCoefficient(double regressionSumOfSquares,
                                  double yVariance)
        linearCorrelationCoefficient Linear correlation coefficient found when we calculate the regression sum of squares over the variance given in y.
        Parameters:
        regressionSumOfSquares - Standard error of mean from having calculated the regression sum of squares.
        yVariance - Variance in y as an array of double values
        Returns:
        Linear correlation coefficient of data as a double

      • errorOffset

        public static double errorOffset(double n,
                 double xVariance,
                 double xMean,
                 double rss)
        errorOffset Gives the error in the offset in a linear fit
        Parameters:
        n - Integer length of the array of data doubles
        xVariance - Variance in x as an array of double values
        xMean - Array of doubles holding the mean x values
        rss - The regression sum of squares as a double
        Returns:
        Error in the y offset constant value of the line of best fit as a double

      • errorGradient

        public static double errorGradient(double xVariance,
                   double rss,
                   int n)
        errorGradient Gives the error in the gradient
        Parameters:
        xVariance - Double holding the value of the variance in x
        rss - Standard error in the mean of x
        Returns:
        Error in the line of best fit's gradient calculation as a double

      • gaussian

        public static double[] gaussian(int numberOfSamples,
                double variance,
                double mean)
        gaussian Transform data into a normalised gaussian
        Parameters:
        numberOfSamples - sample number appropriate to size of original data array
        variance - variance of data
        mean - mean of data
        Returns:
        normalised gaussian in the form of 1D array of doubles

      • convolve

        public static double[] convolve(int[] data,
                double[] gaussian,
                int numberOfSamples)
        convolve convolve data with a normalised gaussian in order to smooth the output after reducing sample rate
        Parameters:
        data - 1D integer data array to be smoothed
        gaussian - normalised gaussian in the form of 1D array of doubles for y axis
        numberOfSamples - sample number appropriate to size of original data array
        Returns:
        Smoothed data as array of doubles

      • convolve

        public static double[] convolve(double[] g1,
                double[] g2)
        convolve convolve two normalised gaussian spreads to get distribution of probabilities.
        Parameters:
        g1 - 1D double containing the first normalised gaussian to convolve
        g2 - 1D double containing the second normalised gaussian to convolve
        Returns:
        Array of doubles containing the normalised gaussian convolution as an array of doubles
